property.name: include
property.value: Map:Common Data

property.name: description
property.value: An area with an excess of garbage originating from the [[Surface]].

property.name: page
property.value: Garbage Dump

property.name: description
property.value: A three-section neighborhood consisting of [[Undyne's House]], [[Napstablook]]'s and [[Mettaton]]'s houses, and the snail farm. On the [[Genocide Route]] the area is evacuated, and no NPCs show up.

property.name: page
property.value: Blook Acres

property.name: description
property.value: [[Undyne]]'s house. She is befriended here if no [[Stats#EXP|EXP]] had been gained at that point.

property.name: page
property.value: Undyne's House

property.name: description
property.value: Hidden village inhabited by [[Temmie]]s.

property.name: page
property.value: Temmie Village

property.name: description
property.value: Scripted encounter against an Aaron.

property.name: description
property.value: Scripted encounter against Shyren.

property.name: description
property.value: Miniboss battle against [[Mad Dummy]]. On the [[Genocide Route]], the dummy becomes corporeal and is renamed to Glad Dummy.

property.name: page
property.value: Mad Dummy/In Battle

property.name: description
property.value: [[Monster Kid]] confronts the protagonist, but the protagonist engages them in battle and attacks them. [[Undyne]] leaps in and takes the fatal blow in their place. She tells Monster Kid to leave and transforms into Undyne the Undying.

property.name: page
property.value: Undyne the Undying

property.name: description
property.value: Boss battle against [[Undyne]]. Her pre-battle monologue changes depending on whether they killed monsters or killed [[Papyrus]].

property.name: page
property.value: Undyne/In Battle

property.name: description
property.value: [[Sans]] offers to take the protagonist to [[Grillby's]]. He leads them through a "shortcut', which teleports them straight there.

property.name: description
property.value: A camera hidden behind the waterfall.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Undyne]] notices the protagonist as they attempt to move through the grass. She refrains from attacking since the grass is under scientific protection. [[Monster Kid]] shows up after she leaves and expresses excitement about the way she was staring at the protagonist.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Undyne]] chases the protagonist across the dock and continuously throws spears at them. The protagonist must make it across while avoiding the spears.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Undyne]] approaches the protagonist and attempts to grab them, only to grab [[Monster Kid]] instead, who expresses excitement that Undyne touched them.

property.name: description
property.value: If the Fun Value is 66, a fake hallway appears after Waterfall's Crystal room. There is an additional 10% chance that a door appears in this hallway.

property.name: page
property.value: Fun Value#Fake Hallway

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can take an umbrella and carry it around with them. The umbrella can be used to prompt altered dialogue with some characters and reveal the solution to the [[Waterfall/Puzzles#The Piano Puzzle|Piano Puzzle]].

property.name: description
property.value: [[Monster Kid]] follows the protagonist throughout the next few rooms.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Monster Kid]] exclaims how cool [[Undyne]] is.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Monster Kid]] relates a story about [[Asgore Dreemurr|Asgore]] coming to school one day and states the possibility of [[Undyne]] coming to school as well.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Monster Kid]] claims that [[Undyne]] would never hurt an innocent person.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Monster Kid]] allows the protagonist to climb on top of their shoulders in order to reach the ledge.

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can place their umbrella here if they are carrying one.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Undyne]] chases the protagonist across the bridge and continuously thrusts spears from underneath. The protagonist must make it across while avoiding the spears.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Undyne]] destroys the bridge with the protagonist on it. The protagonist plummets into the [[Garbage Dump]].

property.name: description
property.value: A brief flashback of [[Asriel Dreemurr]] meeting the [[Chara|first human]]. The flashback cuts off before Asriel says his name.

property.name: description
property.value: On the console versions of [[Undertale]], a donation box appears here on the [[Genocide Route]].

property.name: description
property.value: After interrupting the battle against [[Mad Dummy]], [[Napstablook]] invites the protagonist to their house in [[Blook Acres]].

property.name: description
property.value: A special encounter with [[Aaron]] and [[Woshua]] is triggered here if the protagonist left one of [[Napstablook]]'s CDs playing. This unlocks Aaron's yellow credit text in the [[True Pacifist Ending Credits]].

property.name: description
property.value: [[Papyrus]] appears here and initiates the hangout with [[Undyne]] if no [[Stats#EXP|EXP]] had been gained at that point.

property.name: description
property.value: A house next to [[Napstablook]]'s. It remains locked throughout the game, but it can be unlocked by using the [[Mystery Key]] bought from [[Bratty and Catty]].

property.name: page
property.value: Blook Acres#Mettaton's House

property.name: description
property.value: [[Napstablook]] invites the protagoist to play a game of Thundersnail for the price of 10G.

property.name: description
property.value: This path lights up upon exiting [[Temmie Village]].

property.name: description
property.value: [[Undyne]] corners the protagonist and attempts to take their [[SOUL]]. However, [[Monster Kid]] jumps out at the last second and interrupts the ensuing battle. Undyne drags them away.

properties.property:
Upon backtracking to this spot, [[Flowey]] will have modified the message spoken by the Echo Flower. The message changes depending on whether [[Toriel]] was spared or killed. On the [[Genocide Route]], The Echo Flower still outputs "''(It's strangely silent.)''" but in Toriel's voice.
'''If Toriel was spared:''' '''Toriel:''' Where oh where could that child be...? I've been looking all over for them... '''Flowey:''' ... Hee hee hee. THAT'S not true. She'll find another kid, and instantly forget about you. You'll NEVER see her again.
'''If Toriel was killed:''' '''Toriel:''' Where am I...? It's so cold here... And so dark... Someone help me... Anyone... please... Help me... '''Flowey:''' ... But nobody came.

property.name: description
property.value: They repeat the last message someone has said to it. On the [[Genocide Route]] or if [[Undyne]] was killed on the [[Neutral Route]], all Echo Flowers output the message "''(It's strangely silent.)''"

property.name: page
property.value: Echo Flowers

property.name: description
property.value: If the kill counter has not yet been exhausted at this point, the protagonist is given a reminder of how many monsters remain.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Monster Kid]] confronts the protagonist and asks them to confirm whether they are a human. Monster Kid then attempts to leave, only to trip and fall off the bridge. As they hang onto the ledge below, [[Undyne]] appears on the other side. The protagonist can save Monster Kid, confront Undyne, let Monster Kid fall, or run away into the next room.

property.name: description
property.value: Sells [[Nice Cream]] for 25G and offers a [[Punch Card]] for every purchase. If the protagonist is holding an umbrella, the Nice Cream Guy sells Nice Cream for a discounted price of 15G.

property.name: page
property.value: Nice Cream Guy

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can buy items from Gerson's shop.

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can buy and sell items at the Tem Shop.

property.name: page
property.value: Tem Shop

property.name: description
property.value: A Dimensional Box in the [[Waterfall/Puzzles#The Rock Puzzle|Rock Puzzle Room]].

property.name: page
property.value: Dimensional Box

property.name: description
property.value: A Dimensional Box near [[Sans]]'s telescope.

property.name: page
property.value: Dimensional Box

property.name: description
property.value: A Dimensional Box in front of [[Gerson]]'s shop.

property.name: page
property.value: Dimensional Box

property.name: description
property.value: A Dimensional Box in [[Temmie Village]].

property.name: page
property.value: Dimensional Box

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist must avoid the rocks as they cross the water. The rocks can push the protagonist off the waterfall, after which they must start from the beginning.

property.name: page
property.value: Waterfall/Puzzles#The Rock Puzzle

property.name: description
property.value: A hidden room behind this waterfall.

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist must construct a bridge across the water by aligning four Bridge Seeds in a straight line. To solve this puzzle, the protagonist must construct a horizontal bridge from this spot. On the [[Genocide Route]], this puzzle is already solved.

property.name: page
property.value: Bridge Seed

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist must construct a bridge using four Bridge Seeds to continue forward. There are two solutions to this puzzle. On the [[Genocide Route]], this puzzle is already solved.

property.name: page
property.value: Bridge Seed

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can solve this puzzle by constructing a vertical bridge from this spot.

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can solve this puzzle by constructing a vertical bridge from this spot.

property.name: description
property.value: By constructing a horizontal bridge from this spot, they can access a secret room containing the [[Abandoned Quiche]]. This bridge must still be constructed on the [[Genocide Route]].

property.name: description
property.value: Can be used to reset the [[Bridge Seed]] puzzle to its default state.

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist must interact with this wall to reveal a hidden doorway to the next room.

property.name: page
property.value: Waterfall/Puzzles#The Wishing Room Wall Puzzle

property.name: description
property.value: Using this telescope reveals a hidden clue that directs the protagonist to the northern wall.

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist must play the piano to the tune of ''[[His Theme]]'' in order to unlock the [[Artifact Room]].

property.name: page
property.value: Waterfall/Puzzles#The Piano Puzzle

property.name: description
property.value: If the protagonist places an umbrella on this statue, they can view the solution to the Piano Puzzle.

property.name: page
property.value: Waterfall/Puzzles#The Piano Puzzle

property.name: description
property.value: ''The sound of rushing water fills you with determination.''

property.name: description
property.value: ''A feeling of dread hangs over you... But you stay determined.''

properties.property: Knowing the mouse might one day extract the cheese from the mystical crystal... It fills you with determination.

'''Did not give umbrella to the statue:''' The sound of muffled rain on the cavetop... It fills you with determination.
'''Gave umbrella to the statue:''' The serene sound of a distant music box... It fills you with determination.

'''First time:''' The waterfall here seems to flow from the ceiling of the cavern... Occasionally, a piece of trash will flow through... ... and fall into the bottomless abyss below. Viewing this endless cycle of worthless garbage... It fills you with determination.
'''Second time:''' Partaking in worthless garbage fills you with determination.

property.name: description
property.value: ''You feel a calming tranquility. You're filled with determination.''

property.name: description
property.value: ''You feel... something. You're filled with detemmienation.

property.name: description
property.value: SAVE Point in the [[Echo Flowers|Echo Flower]] hallway. Only appears on the [[Genocide Route]] and disappears after killing [[Undyne the Undying]].

properties.property:
''Before battle:''' The wind is howling. You're filled with determination...
'''If Undyne was spared:''' The howling wind is now a breeze. This gives you determination...
'''If Undyne was killed:''' The wind has stopped. You're filled with determination...

property.name: description
property.value: Exclaims that they are sneaking out to see [[Undyne]] in action.

property.name: page
property.value: Monster Kid

property.name: description
property.value: Explains how [[Echo Flowers]] work.

property.name: page
property.value: Waterfall/NPCs#Echo Flower Explainer

property.name: description
property.value: Appears after the first [[Undyne]] chase. They can ferry the protagonist to the other side of the dock.

property.name: description
property.value: A [[Woshua]] appears here after defeating [[Undyne]] if no monsters have been killed. They complain that everything is dirty and hard to clean up.

property.name: description
property.value: Appears if the [[Fun Value]] is 90 or greater. They are terrified of the idea of a world in which they do not exist. They have additional dialogue if the protagonist is carrying an umbrella.

property.name: page
property.value: Waterfall/NPCs#Goner Kid

property.name: description
property.value: Appears after the first [[Undyne]] chase. They can ferry the protagonist to the other side of the dock.

property.name: description
property.value: Appears in the room behind the gray door. Fades away once interacted with.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Sans]] allows the protagonist to look through his telescope, which is a prank that puts red paint over their eye.

property.name: description
property.value: Has a fixation on stars despite not knowing what they are. They ask the protagonist if they are a star.

property.name: description
property.value: Offers to carry the protagonist over the disproportionately small gap connecting the room containing [[Sans]]'s telescope and the Quiet Area.

property.name: page
property.value: Small Bird

property.name: description
property.value: Offers to carry the protagonist over the disproportionately small gap connecting the Quiet Area to the room containing [[Sans]]'s telescope.

property.name: page
property.value: Small Bird

property.name: description
property.value: Appears out of the water. They talk to the protagonist as they walk across the room. They retreat back into the water as the protagonist leaves the room.

property.name: description
property.value: Relocates here at the end of the [[True Pacifist Route]], having reuinted with her sister [[Shyren]].

property.name: page
property.value: Lemon Bread

property.name: description
property.value: An [[Aaron]] appears here after defeating [[Undyne]] if no monsters have been killed. His dialogue varies depending on whether he heard [[Napstablook]]'s music in [[Blook Acres]].

property.name: description
property.value: A [[Woshua]] appears here after defeating [[Undyne]] if no monsters have been killed. They explain that they are cleaning the garbage.

property.name: description
property.value: Appears if the [[Fun Value]] is between 80 and 89. She mentions that Suzy, her neighbor's daughter, looks to be about the protagonist's age. On the Nintendo Switch and Xbox versions, if the Fun Value is 81, she becomes a "goner" at the end of the [[True Pacifist Route]] and disappears.

property.name: page
property.value: Waterfall/NPCs#Clam Girl

property.name: description
property.value: [[Mad Dummy]] appears here after their battle. On the Nintendo Switch version of [[Undertale]], the dummy is replaced with [[Mad Mew Mew]] after her battle.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Undyne]] provides commentary on the objects inside her house.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Napstablook]] provides commentary on the objects in their house and invites the protagonist to participate in a family tradition.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Napstablook]] relocates here at the end of the [[True Pacifist Route]]. They ask the protagonist for their name since they did not learn it when everyone else did.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Mettaton EX]] relocates here at the end of the [[True Pacifist Route]]. He expresses desire to become a star on the surface and has enlisted [[Shyren]] and [[Napstablook]] to be part of his troupe.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Napstablook]] explains that they work at the Blook Family Snail Farm.

property.name: description
property.value: Does not say anything on its own, but the narration suggests that the protagonist wonders what it tastes like.

property.name: description
property.value: Encourages the protagonist to reach far on their journey.

property.name: description
property.value: A humanoid monster who had just purchased a shell from a snail as a second house.

property.name: description
property.value: Is counting dollar bills, presumably because it had just sold its shell to the Snail Guy.

property.name: description
property.value: Can ferry the protagonist to either [[Snowdin]] or [[Hotland]].

property.name: page
property.value: River Person

property.name: description
property.value: Introduces herself and her friend to the right.

property.name: description
property.value: Introduces herself and her friend to the right.

property.name: description
property.value: Introduces herself and her friend to the right.

property.name: description
property.value: Introduces themself as "Bob" and speaks proper English.

property.name: description
property.value: Recognizes the protagonist as a human and considers them cute.

property.name: description
property.value: Claims that she is watching over an egg in hopes of becoming a parent. The egg is hard-boiled.

property.name: description
property.value: Explains that she, like the protagonist, is allergic to Temmies. The Temmie breaks out in hives afterward.

property.name: description
property.value: Is seen peeking out from behind a hole in the wall.

property.name: description
property.value: Performs a dance for the protagonist and provides commentary depending on whether the protagonist has killed any monster.

property.name: description
property.value: Appears after defeating [[Undyne]]. They have prepared a puzzle for the protagonist to solve, but they immediately criticize them for how they attempt to push the box.

property.name: page
property.value: Waterfall/NPCs#Elder Puzzler

properties.property: All that gives my life validation is explaining the Echo Flower No one can know...
This is a [[Dimensional Box|box]]. You can put an item in or take an item out. Why would you though??? You can't use items when they're in the box! Sincerely, a box hater.

property.name: description
property.value: ''I swore I saw something... Behind that rushing water...''

property.name: description
property.value: ''When four [[Bridge Seed]]s align in the water, they will sprout.''

properties.property: Congratulations! You failed the puzzle!

property.name: description
property.value: ''I just wasn't ready for the responsibility.''

property.name: description
property.value: ''If an error is made, the Bell Blossom can call [[Bridge Seed]]s back to where they started.''

property.name: description
property.value: ''WISHING ROOM''

properties.property: A long time ago, monsters would whisper their wishes to the stars in the sky. If you hoped with all your heart, your wish would come true. Now, all we have are these sparkling stones on the ceiling.
Thousands of people wishing together can't be wrong! [[Asgore Dreemurr|The king]] will prove that.

property.name: description
property.value: ''C'mon, sis! Make a wish!''

property.name: description
property.value: ''I wish my sister and I will see the real stars someday...''

property.name: description
property.value: ''Ah... seems my horoscope is the same as last week's...''

object.name: War of Humans and Monsters, part 1

properties.property:
(Ancient writing covers the walls... you can just make out the words.)
[[The War of Humans and Monsters]].

object.name: War of Humans and Monsters, part 2

properties.property: Why did the [[humans]] attack? Indeed, it seemed they had nothing to fear. Humans are unbelievably strong. It would take the [[SOUL]] of nearly every [[Monsters|monster]]... ...just to equal the power of a single human SOUL.

object.name: War of Humans and Monsters, part 3

properties.property: But [[humans]] have one weakness. Ironically, it is the strength of their [[SOUL]]. Its power allows it to persist outside the human body, even after death.

object.name: War of Humans and Monsters, part 4

properties.property: If a [[Monsters|monster]] defeats a [[Humans|human]], they can take its [[SOUL]]. A monster with a human SOUL... A horrible beast with unfathomable power.

object.name: War of Humans and Monsters, part 5

properties.property: (It's an illustration of a strange creature...) (There is something very unsettling about this drawing.)

property.name: description
property.value: Has been defaced with a list of 21 different flavors.

properties.property:
(You hear a passing conversation.)
So? Don't you have any wishes to make?

(You hear a passing conversation.)
... hmm, just one, but... It's kind of stupid.

(You hear a passing conversation.)
Don't say that! Come on, I promise I won't laugh.

object.name: War of Humans and Monsters, part 6

properties.property: The power to take their [[SOUL]]s. This is the power that the [[humans]] feared.

property.name: description
property.value: ''The northern room hides a great treasure.''

properties.property: A haunting song echoes down the corridor... Won't you play along? Only the first 8 are fine.

object.name: War of Humans and Monsters, part 7

properties.property: This power has no counter. Indeed, a [[Humans|human]] cannot take a [[Monsters|monster]]'s [[SOUL]]. When a monster dies, its SOUL disappears. And an incredible power would be needed to take the SOUL of a living monster.

object.name: War of Humans and Monsters, part 8

properties.property: There is only one exception. The [[SOUL]] of a special species of [[Monsters|monster]] called a "[[Boss Monster]]." A Boss Monster's SOUL is strong enough to persist after death... If only for a few moments. A [[Humans|human]] could absorb this SOUL. But this has never happened. And now it never will.

property.name: description
property.value: ''Please take one.''

object.name: War of Humans and Monsters, part 9

properties.property: The [[humans]], afraid of our power, declared war on us. They attacked suddenly, and without mercy.

object.name: War of Humans and Monsters, part 10

properties.property: In the end, it could hardly be called a war. United, the [[humans]] were too powerful, and us [[monsters]], too weak. Not a single [[SOUL]] was taken, and countless monsters were turned to dust...
North: [[Blook Acres]] East: [[Hotland]] ???: [[Temmie Village]]

object.name: War of Humans and Monsters, part 11

properties.property: Hurt, beaten, and fearful of our lives, we surrendered to the [[humans]]. Seven of their greatest magicians sealed us underground with a magic spell. Anything can enter through the seal, but only beings with a powerful [[SOUL]] can leave.

object.name: War of Humans and Monsters, part 12

properties.property: There is only one way to reverse this spell. If a huge power, equivalent to seven human [[SOUL]]s, attacks the [[barrier]]... It will be destroyed.

object.name: War of Humans and Monsters, part 13

properties.property: But this cursed place has no entrances or exits. There is no way a [[Humans|human]] could come here. We will remain trapped down here forever.
hOI! welcom to... TEM VILLAGE!!!
hOI!! u shud check out... [[Tem Shop|TEM SHOP]]!!!
yaYA!! i AGREES!! shud check... [[Tem Shop|TEM SHOP]]!!!

property.name: description
property.value: ''Without candles or magic to guide them Home, the monsters used crystals to navigate.''

property.name: description
property.value: ''You aren't gonna tell my parents about this, are you?''

properties.property:
(You hear a passing conversation.)
... hmm... if I say my wish... You promise you won't laugh at me?

(You hear a passing conversation.)
Of course I won't laugh!

(You hear a passing conversation.)
Someday, I'd like to climb this mountain we're all buried under. Standing under the sky, looking at the world all around... That's my wish.

(You hear laughter.)
... hey, you said you wouldn't laugh at it!

(You hear a passing conversation.)
Sorry, it's just funny... That's my wish, too.

object.name: War of Humans and Monsters, part 14

properties.property: However... There is a prophecy. The Angel... The One Who Has Seen The [[Surface]]... They will return. And the [[underground]] will go empty.

Dear Diary: [[Lemon Bread|Shyren's sister]] "fell down" recently. It's sad. Without her sister to speak for her... She's become more reclusive than ever. So I reached out to her, and told her... Thst she, [[Napstablook|Blooky]], and I should all perform together sometime. She seemed to like that idea.
Dearer Diary: I like to buy a new diary for every entry I make. I love to collect diaries.

Dearest Diary: Our cousin left the farm to become a training dummy. That leaves just [[Napstablook|Blooky]] and I. Blooky asked me if I was going to try to become corporeal, too. They sounded so... Resigned... Come on, Blooky. You know I'd never leave you behind. And besides... I'd never find the kind of body I'm looking for, anyway.

My Darling Diary: I met someone... Interesting today. Last week I posted that advertisement for my Human Fanclub. Today was our first meeting. Only one other person came. Honestly, she's a dork. And she's obsessed with these awful cartoons. But she's kind of funny, too... I want to see her again.
Diary... My dear: My diary collection is growing fabulously. I have like five now.

Dear Diary: She surprised me with something today. Sketches of a body she wants to create for me... A form beyond my wildest fantasies. In a form like that, I could finally feel like... "myself." After all, there's no way I can become a star the way I am now. Sorry, [[Napstablook|Blooky]]. My dreams can't wait for anyone...

property.name: description
property.value: [[Papyrus]] calls the protagonist and asks them what they are wearing. They can either tell him the truth or lie to him.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Papyrus]] calls the protagonist again and he reveals that he used the protagonist's response to his previous question to attempt to distract [[Undyne]]. Regardless of what they told him or whether they had changed their [[armor]] after the call, Papyrus explains that he had told Undyne what the protagonist is currently wearing.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Papyrus]] calls the protagonist and tells them that they should hang out with [[Undyne]]. If Papyrus was not befriended, he reminds the protagonist that they should hang out with him first.

property.name: description
property.value: On the [[True Pacifist Route]], [[Papyrus]] calls the protagonist and tells them to head to [[Alphys]]'s [[Lab]].

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can pick up the Old Tutu in this area.

property.name: page
property.value: Old Tutu

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can obtain the Abandoned Quiche from underneath this bench.

property.name: page
property.value: Abandoned Quiche

property.name: description
property.value: A box containing one Punch Card for every [[Nice Cream]] purchased.

property.name: page
property.value: Punch Card

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can pick up the Ballet Shoes in this area.

property.name: page
property.value: Ballet Shoes

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist attempts to claim the artifact, only for the [[Annoying Dog]] to appear in their inventory, preventing them from obtaining it. Deploying the dog causes it to absorb the artifact, leving [[Dog Residue]] behind.

property.name: page
property.value: Artifact Room

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can pick up two pieces of Astronaut Food from this cooler.

property.name: page
property.value: Astronaut Food
